{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498477,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T23:48:19.565Z","cooked":"

Hello,

I’m certain they are built correctly but if we try to fully tighten the screws it completely binds up. Has anyone seen this before? Any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T23:48:19.565Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484535,"topic_slug":"vortex-maxswerve-unable-to-tighten","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/vortex-maxswerve-unable-to-tighten/484535/1","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3498481,"name":"KaseyB","username":"KaseyB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaseyb/{size}/176177_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T23:52:31.491Z","cooked":"

I’m guessing you mean when you secure the top and bottom plates with the 3 bolts?

If so there are probably 2 main things to investigate as we’ve seen issues in both areas:

  1. Ensure the driving pinion on the end of the shaft has the boss riding on the bearing race. If that is flipped over, the driving motor won’t spin.
  2. Don’t secure the back side of the integrated MaxSwerve vortex shaft as they have some runout issues that can be problematic.

I’ve never had this problem. I know that rev recommended running with the set screws removed for the eccentric vortexes, but I doubt that is the problem. I do think that you will be fine if you run MaxSwerve without the set screws.

Oops I misread the post
Refer to the post above me

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T23:53:59.917Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484535,"topic_slug":"vortex-maxswerve-unable-to-tighten","display_username":"Eliot Dunn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52966,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"111 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/vortex-maxswerve-unable-to-tighten/484535/3","custom_user_title":"111 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498510,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T00:18:12.279Z","cooked":"
KaseyB:

Ensure the driving pinion on the end of the shaft has the boss riding on the bearing race. If that is flipped over, the driving motor won’t spin.

That was it. I guess I need to read better
